title: Supports and Sightstone
body:
TL;DR - Comment on possible changes to sightstone so supports don't have to rush this every game.

Other roles have different build paths and first item options but supports always have to buy sightstone first. This puts them behind on their first item purchase when they're already last in gold. I usually get pinks when laning as well and if the enemy finds these I have to buy another. This means between sightstone and pinks I may have well spent my first 1k on nothing but wards (Sightstone hp >.>). The gold items for supports are nice but I cringe at not getting my sightstone first.

Just a thought to a possible change being directed at ward trinkets. Maybe adding the option of two trinkets that both store wards over time. One trinket would take longer to get a charge but the wards last 3 minutes. The other trinket would store charges faster but the wards would only last 1 minute (Explorer wards?) useful for split pushers that are applying pressure. Would keep the no more than 3 wards out at a time rule. Sweep would still be an option. Not sure how the upgrading would work though...

Maybe I'm the only one... I've seen other threads wanting to make sightstone a trinket itself. I'm not concerned with the extra item slot.. I never get full build anyways. It would just be nice to have a build path that didn't start with my first 1k going to wards.

>This puts them behind on their first item purchase when they're already last in gold. 

Sightstone IS your first item purchase, and your MOST IMPORTANT item in the game.


>This means between sightstone and pinks I may have well spent my first 1k on nothing but wards (Sightstone hp >.>). 

During laning phase you don't even need anything else. As a support your purpose is to keep your ADC alive and provide vision to your lane and Dragon. Nothing more, nothing less. If you are fantasizing about dmg and stuff, then don't play support. 

>It would just be nice to have a build path that didn't start with my first 1k going to wards.

And this is exactly the reason why you are still in Bronze, bro. You have no clue how to play this game and how important the vision is...

> And this is exactly the reason why you are still in Bronze, bro. You have no clue how to play this game and how important the vision is...

Ad hominem for the crime of questioning a specific strategy? 

Anyway, I have a question. Is it fair for the adc to spend 250 gold upgrading his trinket, and the occasional equivalent of three minions to buy a ward here or there? Or am I bronze for thinking that it's not only the support's job?

Sure the ADC could upgrade the trinket, would help your team to get vision and maybe couple of wards if the support is a tool and doesn't know what he/she is doing and doesn't understand the importance of vision. 

At the end of the day, it's supports job to keep the bottom lane + drake warded, not the ADCs.

A ward costs three minions. Supports have the lowest income in the game. Why is it their job again?

Look, people keep saying "it's the support's job" without giving any reasons beyond "muh items." Please, give me a reason why the adc can't spare that gold for the sake of helping the team.

It seems to me that you don't actually Like playing support. When I'm playing support. I'm actually glad that I can rush Sight stone. Nothing is quite more Gold Efficient than this endless fountain of wards. It freaking pays for itself after a couple of wards are placed.

And the reason I like Rushing it early is not even Objective control. I can not only ward river, but also the side brush, making sure that the bot lane does not pull off any shenanigans. And considering you have maybe one sweeper in bot lane, the opponent would have to chose which wards they clear out.

The only time I really don't rush sight stone. is if bot lane is behind, or if for some reason I need to stop supporting. The latter case happens if the ADC a) Royally fks up or b) goes AKF. And in the Former case, if our lane is constantly pushed to our tower. MS would allow me to better juke skill shots and get back to lane quicker. 

But if your Bot lane is Clearly ahead. Sight stone is the best choice because you can press the advantage without worry about being ambushed.

Now their is a fact that Sight stone can be slot inefficient. and limits the Options late game. But as the one with the least gold, this should rarely be an issue. But it's also worth that much more during the late game because everyone else will be full build and have no slots left for wards. And yet their will probably be problems if Sightstone, or its upgrade (or future upgrades) ever become slot efficient enough to be a general build item. 

Another thing to consider about Wards is that Vision has to be balance around the ability to deny it. I don't know what it was like in past seasons. But I do remember Oracle elixir being scraped, with the Trinket wards and sweeping lenses coming into play. Fast forward to the current season. Trinket Upgrades are being severely buffed (except sweeping lens). while the smite bonus on raptors give us more vision denial. (and extra vision with control of the scuttle crab.) 

I analyze this and I would say that the vision game is going to get more Trinketised. Particularly in the mid to late game after level 9. While giving a weary hover over vision Denial. But this by no means is making Sight stone any worse.
